snippet: Ireland voted overwhelmingly to ratify a treaty designed to bind European Union member states to tighter budgetary controls in an effort to address the sovereign debt crisis.
abstract: Ireland votes overwhelmingly to ratify treaty intended to bind European Union member states to tighter budgetary controls in effort to address the sovereign debt crisis that is threatening the euro; treaty, also known as the fiscal stability pact, must be ratified by 12 of the 17 euro zone counties if it is to come into force as planned in 2013.
lead_paragraph: Ireland voted overwhelmingly to ratify a treaty designed to bind European Union member states to tighter budgetary controls in an effort to address the sovereign debt crisis.

headline.main: Ireland Approves Treaty to Set European Union Budget Controls
headline.print_headline: Ireland Approves Treaty to Set European Union Budget Controls
